intro: Chelidonium aurantiacum, commonly known as the golden poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes other well-known species such as罂粟 (opium poppy). It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in coastal areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
